ADVENT.Defintion: the fact of an event happening, an invention being made, or a person arriving

ANTI-SEMITISM.Defintion: the strong dislike or cruel and unfair treatment of Jewish people

ARISTOCRACY.Defintion: a class of people who hold high social rank

ARITHMETIC.Defintion: the part of mathematics that involves the adding and multiplying, etc. of numbers

AVERTED.Defintion: to prevent something bad from happening

BENT OVER BACKWARDS.Defintion: do everything possible, make every possible effort

BREADCRUMBS.Defintion: very small pieces of dried bread, especially used in cooking

CLICHÃ‰.Defintion: a saying or remark that is very often made and is therefore not original and not interesting

CONTROVERSY.Defintion: a lot of disagreement or argument about something, usually because it affects or is important to many people

DEVIATION.Defintion: a difference from what is usual or expected

FATEFUL.Defintion: something that has far-reaching and often disastrous consequences or implications

GREASEPROOF.Defintion: paper that does not allow oil through, used especially in cooking

GREASY.Defintion: covered with or full of fat or oil

HOME COMFORTS.Defintion: things in a house that make it comfortable. warmth and light and all our modern home comforts

HOME FRONT.Defintion: the people who stay in their own country during a foreign war

HUMBLE.Defintion: ordinary; not special or very important

HUT.Defintion: a small, simple building, usually consisting of one room

IN ACCORDANCE.Defintion: following or obeying a rule, law, wish, etc.

INLAND.Defintion: in the middle of a country, away from the sea

MUSHY.Defintion: peas that are soft and have no firm shape

PAYDAY.Defintion: the day of the month when you are paid

PLETHORA.Defintion: a very large amount of something, especially a larger amount than you need, want, or can deal with

PLUMMETED.Defintion: to fall very quickly and suddenly

PORTIONS.Defintion: the amount of a particular food that is served to one person, especially in a restaurant or a shop that sells food ready to be eaten

RAGE.Defintion: to happen in a strong or violent way

RATIONED.Defintion: to limit the amount of a particular thing that someone is allowed to have

REGIME.Defintion: a particular government or a system or method of government

RESOURCEFUL.Defintion: skilled at solving problems and making decisions on your own

SELF-RESPECTING.Defintion: used to say that someone has the qualities that a person of that type should have

SHABBAT.Defintion: the Jewish day of rest and religious worship, celebrated on Saturday

SMOTHERED.Defintion: to cover most or all of a surface

SNOOTY.Defintion: behaving in an unfriendly way because you believe you are better than other people

STAPLE.Defintion: a basic food, or a main product or material

STAVING OFF.Defintion: to prevent something, or prevent someone from doing something, esp. until a later time

TOLERATE.Defintion: to accept or continue to accept an unpleasant situation or experience, or someone who behaves unpleasantly

TRANSITION.Defintion: a change from one form or type to another, or the process by which this happens

TRAWL.Defintion: to pull a large, cone-shaped net through the sea at a deep level behind a special boat in order to catch fish

WILDFIRE.Defintion: a fire that is burning strongly and out of control on an area of grass or bushes in the countryside
